snippet: Eddie Ray Routh, accused of killing Chris Kyle, the author of “American Sniper,” had been released from a hospital over his parents’ objections just days before the shooting, his lawyers said.
abstract: Lawyers for Eddie Ray Routh, former Marine accused of killing author and retired Navy SEAL sniper Chris Kyle, say he was released from veterans hospital over his parents’ objections just days before shooting.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and KATHRYN JONES
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Dallas, and Kathryn Jones from Lancaster, Tex.

lead_paragraph: Eddie Ray Routh, accused of killing Chris Kyle, the author of “American Sniper,” had been released from a hospital over his parents’ objections just days before the shooting, his lawyers said.

headline.seo: Eddie Ray Routh, Accused of Killing Chris Kyle, ‘American Sniper,’ Had Troubled Past
headline.main: Suspect in Texas Veteran’s Killing Was Hospitalized
headline.print_headline: Suspect in Texas Veteran’s Killing Was Hospitalized

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
